intro: Barnardiella spiralis, commonly known as the spiral spiraea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant's leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, silvery down. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
